  • Some programming experience

Setting up development environment

Hardware

Tools

You’ll need the following “components”. There are many “softwares” which can be used for each component

  1. Ethereum Client: This will be the blockchain that runs on your local system. It could be
    1. Ganache
    2. Geth
    3. Or any one of the supported.
  2. Block Explorer (Optional): Sometimes you will want block explorer to keep a track of transactions and be able to search on them. There are many choices available. We’ve found Blockscout to be very powerful, and there are many others which are lightweight and simple.

Other useful links

The Black Book of Blockchain is maintained by blockchain-d. This is a community effort and we try our best to do provide correct and updated information here. In case you notice an issue, please report it on github issues. You can contribute by forking it and raise a PR with correction.

Checkout the Github repo for the book.
